intro: Babingtonia bidwillii, commonly known as the Sydney ghost pipe or ghost gum, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that typically grows in coastal and tableland regions. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, pale yellow or white flowers that are clustered in spikes, which bloom in spring. Babingtonia bidwillii is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in sandy soils.
